DataElement.preferredName: Attitudes and Preferences Questionnaire How Important Standard Treatment Improves Quality of Life Score 5 Point Scale
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Person's stated observation of how important it is that standard treatment improves quality of life, based on a five-point Likert scale.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Attitudes and Preferences Questionnaire How Important Standard Treatment Improves Quality of Life Score
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A habitual or characteristic mental attitude that determines how a person will interpret and respond to situations._An article which expresses the relation of connection or addition. It is used to conjoin a word with a word, a clause with a clause, or a sentence with a sentence._The act, fact, or principle of giving advantages to some particular person, object, or course of action over others; designated as more desirable._Predetermined sets of questions used to collect data - clinical data, social status, occupational group, etc. The term is often applied to a self-completed survey instrument._A question about how an individual rates the importance that standard treatment improves quality of life._A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

ValueDomain.preferredName: Attitudes and Preferences Questionnaire Importance Score 5 Point Scale
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Numeric scores from 0 (Not at all important) to 4 (Extremely important) on a Likert scale used on the Attitudes and Preferences questionnaire.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A subjective score of 2 on a scale that ranges from 0: Not at all important to 4: Extremely important.

Concepts.definition: A subjective score of 2 on a scale that ranges from 0: Not at all important to 4: Extremely important.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A subjective score of 4 on a scale that ranges from 0: Not at all important to 4: Extremely important.

Concepts.definition: A subjective score of 4 on a scale that ranges from 0: Not at all important to 4: Extremely important.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A subjective score of 3 on a scale that ranges from 0: Not at all important to 4: Extremely important.

Concepts.definition: A subjective score of 3 on a scale that ranges from 0: Not at all important to 4: Extremely important.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A subjective score of 1 on a scale that ranges from 0: Not at all important to 4: Extremely important.

Concepts.definition: A subjective score of 1 on a scale that ranges from 0: Not at all important to 4: Extremely important.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A subjective score of 0 on a scale that ranges from 0: Not at all important to 4: Extremely important.

Concepts.definition: A subjective score of 0 on a scale that ranges from 0: Not at all important to 4: Extremely important.

Concepts.definition: An ordered reference standard used to measure incremental changes.
